text:
NEW: DHS Sec. John Kelly on EO: Lawful Permanent Residents now allowed into the U.S. Posted at 7:50 pm on January 29, 2017 by Greg P. Share on Facebook Share on Twitter 
Apparently DHS Secretary John Kelly has just ruled that Lawful Permanent Residents ‚Äî aka Green Card holders ‚Äî from the 7 banned countries will be allowed into the country: Update on @POTUS EO Implementation: Secretary Kelly judges entry of #LPRs to be in the national interest: https://t.co/Es1qivoR3J 
‚Äî Homeland Security (@DHSgov) January 29, 2017 Statement By Secretary John Kelly On The Entry Of Lawful Permanent Residents Into The United States ‚Üí https://t.co/Es1qivoR3J pic.twitter.com/hffMK2MOQC 
‚Äî Homeland Security (@DHSgov) January 29, 2017 
DHS also wants everyone to know that the agency is in compliance with the court orders: DHS Statement on Compliance with Court Orders and the President's Executive Orders ‚Üí https://t.co/zCqQxUhbPd 
‚Äî Homeland Security (@DHSgov) January 30, 2017 DHS Statement on Compliance with Court Orders and the President's Executive Orders ‚Üí https://t.co/zCqQxUhbPd 
‚Äî Homeland Security (@DHSgov) January 30, 2017 DHS claims to be in compliance with court orders pic.twitter.com/51XzvzTmJC 
‚Äî Zeke Miller (@ZekeJMiller) January 30, 2017 
A Senior Administration Official (SAO) went on to brief reporters, calling the EO ‚Äúa massive success story on implementation on every single level‚Äù: SAO: All three of President Trump‚Äôs EOs were reviewed by OLC 
‚Äî Zeke Miller (@ZekeJMiller) January 29, 2017 SAO on green card holders: ‚Äú~170 people had applied and 170 people had received that waiver‚Äù 
‚Äî Zeke Miller (@ZekeJMiller) January 29, 2017 SAO explains that green card holders are covered, but policy is to grant waiver unless "derogatory information" is found. 
‚Äî Zeke Miller (@ZekeJMiller) January 29, 2017 SAO on those set aside for additional screening ‚Äúfractional marginal miniscule percentage‚Äù of travelers 
‚Äî Zeke Miller (@ZekeJMiller) January 29, 2017 SAO: ‚ÄúIt really is a massive success story on implementation on every single level‚Äù 
‚Äî Zeke Miller (@ZekeJMiller) January 29, 2017 SAO recasts the EO as ‚Äúessentially a 90 day pause on non-essential travel and most new ordinary migration‚Äù 
‚Äî Zeke Miller (@ZekeJMiller) January 29, 2017 SAO: ‚ÄúThe actual op of the waiver is such that in the absence of derogatory info, the waiver is approved, ergo they are exempt from the EO‚Äù 
‚Äî Zeke Miller (@ZekeJMiller) January 29, 2017 
Townhall‚Äôs Guy Benson weighs in on how President Trump could have avoided the ‚Äúworst optics imaginable‚Äù: WH has backtracked on EO barring entry for LPR/green card holders. What a massive, unforced, idiotic initial error. https://t.co/voICyDijqJ 
‚Äî Guy Benson (@guypbenson) January 29, 2017 imagine if they'd consulted relevant agencies & lawyers, avoided LPR debacle, exempted ppl in transit & limited pause to new issuances‚Ä¶ 
‚Äî Guy Benson (@guypbenson) January 29, 2017 ‚Ä¶and given Congressional allies a heads up & furnished supporters w/ citations of how Obama-era list of countries was selected‚Ä¶ 
‚Äî Guy Benson (@guypbenson) January 29, 2017 ‚Ä¶instead, this inept mess & the worst optics imaginable, atop sloppy policy. üëé
